This needs a license, else I'll have to pull the download from the Spaceport

Isn't Nasa logo in public domain?
NASA still images; audio files; video; and computer files used in the rendition of 3-dimensional models, such as texture maps and polygon data in any format, generally are not copyrighted. You may use NASA imagery, video, audio, and data files used for the rendition of 3-dimensional models for educational or informational purposes, including photo collections, textbooks, public exhibits, computer graphical simulations and Internet Web pages. This general permission extends to personal Web pages.

This general permission does not extend to use of the NASA insignia logo (the blue "meatball" insignia), the retired NASA logotype (the red "worm" logo) and the NASA seal. These images may not be used by persons who are not NASA employees or on products (including Web pages) that are not NASA-sponsored. http://www.nasa.gov/audience/formedia/features/MP_Photo_Guidelines.html#.UoR4PuJVhAs

however, this is not any of the actual NASA logo's, it's just the NASA font spelling 'NASA'.

Edited November 14, 2013 by trekkie_
It'S not a matter of the logo or copyirght, it's simply a matter than addons on the forum and spaceport need a license. You can simply write "all rights reserved" and that would be it

This needs a license, else I'll have to pull the download from the Spaceport
It'S not a matter of the logo or copyirght, it's simply a matter than addons on the forum and spaceport need a license. You can simply write "all rights reserved" and that would be it

... Choose a License ...

I tried that whole "You can simply write "all rights reserved" and that would be it", but then was told I needed a license and was referred to the link above.

Edited November 14, 2013 by CoriW

... Choose a License ...

I tried that whole "You can simply write "all rights reserved" and that would be it", but then was told I needed a license and referred to the link above.

I usually put something short along the lines of "cannot be modified without permission" or "can be modified freely"

All Rights Reserved is a good enough license, just state below what the person can and cannot do under. Like "you are free to use but not distribute or modify this". Anyway you need something of the sort up there.

I usually put something short along the lines of "cannot be modified without permission" or "this can be modified freely"

Yeah usually that's alright, although if you use the link I provided to pick a license you actually have the benefit of having a "real" license and also get a cool little picture to go along with it.

Also pretty sure forum rules require the license to be put in the forum thread and in the download, just to let you know.

I usually put something short along the lines of "cannot be modified without permission" or "can be modified freely"

Well, pick one.

Shield looks nice!

Edited November 14, 2013 by Motokid600

The heatshields in the mod are absoultely gigantic. I'd say it looks about 5m. Good if you need to land a nice huge space station on Duna for some reason, but for a usual crew transfer vehicle? This thing would need to be launched independently for each re-entry... Other than the really oversized model, nice job!
